alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 25 at 12:39PM AKST until January 28 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Blowing snow possible for Thompson Pass. Total snow accumulations of 18 to 30 inches possible for Valdez and Keystone Canyon. Total snow accumulations of 28 to 40 inches for Thompson Pass. Wind gusts up to 40 mph Friday evening through Saturday morning for Thompson Pass. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..Snow is expected to develop Friday evening with periods of heavy snow possible Friday night through Saturday morning. The snow is then expected to diminish in intensity Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. A second round of heavy snow is then expected Saturday evening through Sunday morning before slowly tapering off through the day Sunday. Gusty winds through Thompson Pass at the onset of the snow could result in blowing snow. Blowing snow may reduce visibility to as low as one quarter mile through Thompson Pass through Saturday morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
